We first transformed the marginal distributions of VPD and SM into normalized ranks ranging from 0 to 1 [from F
X ( x), F
Y ( y) to u, v]. To select an appropriate bivariate copula for each grid cell, we fit all possible bivariate copula families (40 in total, listed in table S3) and selected the best one according to the Bayesian information criterion in the R package, VineCopula (function “BiCopSelect”) (
42 ). With the copula of the best fit, we then calculated the joint probability of extreme high VPD (above its 90th percentile) and low SM (below its 10th percentile) using the function “BiCopCDF” in VineCopula.
